title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: March 10
body:
Hey all,

Happy Friday! Few short notes below.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Aatrox hotfix**

All going according to plan we should be putting out a balance hotfix for Aatrox today. We concluded he was definitely in too poor a state to leave until the next regular patch and wasn't likely to recover enough just based off relearning. Changes include increased starting health (580, was 537 and had been kept low historically because of the impact of the previous revive in lane), Q CD down (13-11, was 16-12) and W damage up (45-185, was 30-150). Suspect it's likely we'll also make Aatrox changes in 7.6, though we'll need to see where these put him first of course.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Rek'Sai Timing**

It looks like the Rek'Sai small update's going to be after mid-season at this point (we won't have the artist time needed available until then).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Mid-season**

Speaking of which it's very likely mid-season will be patch 7.9. That could still change of course, but that's what we're shooting for.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Next new champ**

The next new champ will be coming out before the next VGU. Once they're out we'll also share some details for anyone curious as to why the longer than usual gap between new champ releases and whether the circumstances that caused it are likely to crop up again or not.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Knight's Vow on PBE**

We saw some reports yesterday that Knight's Vow had been reverted to its older stats and build path on the PBE yesterday. Going to be looking into that today, it's not an intended change so it's either a datamining error or we've accidentally stomped the newer version with an old file somehow.

Why the sudden interest in ninja tabi use?

The rise of ninja tabi is due to the fact that the 10% dmg reduction, specifically against lethality adc's and lethality-building champs in general is currently more valuable than CDR or tenacity.
Notice the word **currently**. The boots weren't the be all end all before you implemented lethality. People bought tenacity and CDR boots. Junglers loved swiftness and mobility. But this meta isn't full of CC tanks and CDR is plntiful outside of boots. It's full of low CC assassins and adc's bulding lethality. And in order to **survive** long enough to do anything WE LITERALLY NEED THOSE BOOTS!
The boots themselves have been fine for an extremely long time, and have only now rose in popularity because they are a need against the currrent lethality meta. Not a want. Hell I'd take any other boots any day of the week if lethalty wasn't a problem.
Kinda like boots enchants. We didn't buy the best one, we simply bought the least shit one. In this case ninja tabi are the least shit pair of boots against lethality users.

We're more interested in Ninja Tabi because Ninja Tabi are much more common. That's generally a sign something's worth paying attention to. So far it looks like Ninja Tabi are an appropriate response to multiple physical damage based enemies using flat pen (Lethality) which is strongly countered by additional armor.

So at this point, do you feel ninja tabi are an issue as a "too strong" reactionary item to lethality.
Or lethality is a problem because it is causing such a rise in ninja tabi usage?

Ahhh wait. Can I give some input on graves pls? I have more games than I can count on him and would love to save my guy from unnecessary nerfs. 

Graves is benefiting from a few things right now:

* All of the people that could compete with his early game were nerfed. Kha and rengar both provided safe early clears but also gank pressure, which meant that although graves had a safer clear, he sacrificed better pressure on lanes and the possibility of snowballing heavily through kills.

* Graves' synergy with Maw is stupid, and where I think the best place would be for nerfs would be. The passive shield on maw is more effective on graves than anyone else becuase of True Grit. With the runes/masteries I run now (scaling mr blue/oppressor/unyielding), Graves can have up to an almost 600 magic damage shield. Playing ap junglers into graves especially is miserable atm because of this.

* Phantom Dancer. This is another item that's just too good on him. The damage reduction is a lot of hidden power, and is one of the most frustrating things to play against when graves already has so much survivability.

Meddler, is the team planning on doing anything to reduce the stacking of BC and LW? It's super depressing to be Taric, who is supposed to be award late game for suffering through my terrible early game by being tanky, only to be deleted because BC+LW reduces my 400 armor to nothing. I have no other items I can buy to give me added durability.

Even if the ADC doesn't buy BC, someone else does because it is so generalist. I WILL have a fully stack BC debuff from someone and die nearly instantly. I think this is a big source of late game Tank problems. 

Have you considered not allowing BC to shred for the entire team and limit it to the user?

Taric has miserable mana costs, is saddled with low power spike early items and is getting trounced late game by the shred. His Ult is basically all he has left to try and survive because his shields and heals are too meager to survive focus fire. He has no built in % damage reduction.

This seemed like a balance team concern because you already changed Lord Dom and BC. 45% armor reduction and fully stacked 30% total armor reduction is too much. This doesn't even take into account any lethality or mastery pen. 

I feel terrible picking Taric even into full AD teams because I know I'm screwing my team with my pick.
